Memorandum by the Home Secretary.This Bill was circulated to the Cabinet last October (CP. 448(85)). The Bill makes certain amendments of the existing law whioh are urgently required in the interests of public safety. It has been prepared in' consultation with the representatives of the chief Oil Companies and is now in a form which the Oil Companies are prepared to accept.The Bill passed the Lords last Session "but time could not be found for it in the Commons.One or two additions and modifications on points of detail have been fee-esa suggested to me by the Board of Trade and local authorities and I am- now in consultation with the Board and the Companies on these points.The Bill is one of those whioh might be introduced into the House of Lords and I suggest that its introduction should be approved by the Cabinet, subject to any alteration on points of detail whioh may be found desirable.W.J.H.5th February, 1926.
